td.content: s:27 yr old male presents with mild dizziness. he also reports mild blurred vision, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild dizziness. 3 days ago he sustained a blow to the front of the head.No loss of consciousness o:Height 72 in, Weight 136 lbs, Temperature 99.2 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, NAD, Neck = supple w/o TTP, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL w/ no deficits, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Psych = Mood, affect NL, appropriate judgement a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:m gold smith aged 27 ys presents for recheck following traumatic incident. he was seen in local EMD for injuries, including a concussion. he reports doing fine with no problems and denies blurred vision, dizziness and nausea o:Height 71 in, Weight 132 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=96,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=44,Reaction Time=0.48, HEENT = NCAT, PERRL, C/V = RRR, Abd = Soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Neck = Supple, Pulm = CTAB. Good respiratory effort, MS = Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with no loss of consciousness). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
